programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part two of two. The day of Karen's big event arrives, but Ashley gives Les an ultimatum that could change American Jewelry and Loan for ever.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Pilot of the series following colourful life in a large pawn shop, as run by the Gold family. From alligators to false limbs, its staff has no idea what could come through the door next, and profits come with a huge risk.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ancient alien therorists investigate evidence suggesting that extraterrestrials have played a pivotal role in the progress of mankind.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: Laser weapons and tele-transporters would probably all be fitted to an alien spaceship. But what if they could be used by humans too?.

programme.title: Engineering Disasters
programme.desc: How a storm took out nine dams in Colorado, flooding entire towns and leaving thousands stranded. Plus, the train carrying hazardous materials that derailed, releasing toxic vapours throughout a small New Jersey community and a cargo jet that crashed seconds after take off in Afghanistan.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Richard Harrison and Rick examine an American Civil War bugle, and meet a former prime minister's grandson who brings a clock presented to his grandfather by former US president Richard Nixon.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers examine a flag from one of Nasa's last missions to the moon, signed by the Apollo 16 crew, before viewing a set of NFL pins.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers get the chance to buy the suit of KFC founder Colonel Sanders and a vintage punching-bag game.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers examine a collection of Sammy Davis Jr's personal tapes, and a pair of 1950s Schwinn Phantom bicycles.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers travel to the latest set of auctions in Fullerton, California, where Jarrod and Brandi compete for a storage unit they need to keep their store afloat.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers are far from home and get the opportunity to find out who has the skills for the job and who is just relying on luck.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen and Ton are after a Hollywood ending at an auction in Tinsel Town. They also take a bumpy ride on a camel.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen and Ton go head to head with New Orleans' locals at The Big Easy where a musical item at the auction sets their pulses racing.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A man brings in a boer head in hope of a trade, and a woman wants cash for a fur coat despite the summer heat. Series following life in a large pawn shop..

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A threatening customer puts the store on a high alert, while Ashley and Seth bet on whether a stripper's pole will sell.

programme.title: Engineering Disasters
programme.desc: The San Bruno pipeline explosion of September 2010, when, in a suburb of San Francisco, a 30-inch diameter steel natural gas pipeline ruptured, killing eight residents.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: The story of two researchers who launch an investigation into the supposed UFO crash in Shag Harbour, Nova Scotia on October 4, 1967. Locals claim to have seen and heard the craft hovering above the surface before falling into the waters off the shoreline. While the Navy, coast guard and police were all dispatched, the government claims there was no trace of anything suspicious.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate ancient tales and accounts of robots, contemplating that if such sophisticated machines did exist in bygone days, what might have happened to them.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: A look at a theory that suggests aliens may have colonised an ice-free Antarctica, before a global event plunged it into the Ice Age.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: With big money at stake the teams are determined to stay on the water, but doubts are raised when sharks venture perilously close to the boats.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen and Ton head to an auction in Louisiana, but the duo are out of their league due to a lack of Southern hospitality.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen and Ton travel to Missouri to stay with Ton's sister for some rest and recuperation, but on the way they head for an auction.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths return to the Middle Ages when they are tasked with forging a Crusader's Dagger from a thick rod of steel. The final two smiths that survive a daunting round of tests return to their home forges to create a weapon that helped steal from the rich and give to the poor - Robin Hood's Steel Takedown Bow.

programme.title: Forged: Man At Arms
programme.sub-title: Man at Arms: Art of War
programme.desc: Up for recreation are two blades from top video game The Witcher, namely the Aerondight Silver Sword and the Warhammer. How will they fare in real life?.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Midnight in the Gardena Good and Evil
programme.desc: Barry Weiss hires a psychic to tell him what he thinks is inside a locker and help him decide whether to purchase its contents.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi Passante and Jarrod Schulz enter into a fierce battle against rival Dave Hester as they search California's storage units for valuables and forgotten jewels.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen and Ton are after a Hollywood ending at an auction in Tinsel Town. They also take a bumpy ride on a camel.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen and Ton go head to head with New Orleans' locals at The Big Easy where a musical item at the auction sets their pulses racing.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Comedian Jo Brand hosts an extended edition of the satirical current affairs quiz from October 2016, with former Liberal Democrats leader Tim Farron and football pundit Chris Kamara joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guest players Ben Miller, Henning Wehn, Doon Mackichan and Alex Brooker to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: Previously unseen footage from the second series of the chat show, with highlights including Julian Clary explaining why he avoids readers of a certain magazine, and Johnny Vegas revealing his favourite comedian who never made it in showbusiness. Plus, Jack Dee tells the story of how he lost his car at a service station.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: The host is joined by Bill Bailey, Diane Morgan, Steve Pemberton and Romesh Ranganathan. Topics up for discussion include Latex disasters and dental wonders.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Dozens of amateur racers hurtle through the Chilean capital of Santiago, with only gravity propelling their wacky homemade vehicles.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori buy storage units at an auction in Redondo Beach, where a safe sparks plenty of interest.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Tempers flare between Brandon and his wife Lori as the bidding at an auction soon escalates.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Featuring a Texas attorney, who has a second life as a super picker, and possesses a wild warehouse of eclectic things.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys discover the ultimate coin-op man cave hidden on a farm in upstate New York, and Frank hatches a plan to help lonely collectors find love.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Dozens of amateur racers hurtle through the Chilean capital of Santiago, with only gravity propelling their wacky homemade vehicles.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Compilation of two features on classic cars and SUVs. The presenters immerse themselves in the world of classic cars, with Jeremy Clarkson in a Fiat 124 Spider, Richard Hammond in an MGB GT and James May in a Peugeot 304 Cabriolet. They also enter the realm of the sports utility vehicle as they find out what sort of SUV can be bought for just a few hundred pounds before putting them through a series of challenges.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers are suspicious when an elderly couple arrive from Mexico with five suitcases but no clothes, and a truck carrying garden furniture has something extra in the load.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: The staging of the Aintree Grand National sees the team working flat-out trying to get two new police motorbikes converted in time. Second-in-command Tony finds himself on the wrong end of a 4x4 challenge.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May buy second-hand lorries and set about discovering how difficult it is to become an HGV driver. The Porsche 911 and Lamborghini Gallardo are put to the test, and Michael Parkinson is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Chris Harris and Freddie Flintoff tackle the Baja 1000t off-road race. On the test track, a showdown is held between a Renault hot hatch, a Porsche sports car and an old Lamborghini. Guests Laurence and Emilia Fox drop in to the studio.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: The celebrity humiliation continues at the hands of wicked Greg Davies, as Bob Mortimer champions sausage meat and Sally Phillips returns to the womb.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Ellie Taylor, Steve Pemberton, Fern Britton and Josh Widdicombe test their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games this week.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? The Unseen Bits
programme.desc: Host Rob Brydon and team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack return with previously unseen material from the ninth series of the comedy panel show. Features a stellar cast of celebrity guests, who try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guest players Ben Miller, Henning Wehn, Doon Mackichan and Alex Brooker to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts an extended edition of the quiz with a difference, as comedians Phill Jupitus and Bridget Christie and Only Connect presenter Victoria Coren Mitchell join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer questions on the theme of public and private.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Angela Barnes, Guz Khan, Tom Davis and Harriet Kemsley are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: In the semi-final, Nish Kumar is presented with a coconut harness, while a blindfolded Sally Phillips handles a slice of bread.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? At Christmas
programme.desc: Rob Brydon introduces a seasonal special of the comedy panel game. Musical comedian Bill Bailey, actor and writer Ruth Jones, comedian and presenter Jo Brand and athlete-turned-presenter Kelly Holmes join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack, trying to hoodwink their opponents with a few festive fibs or facts about themselves.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Comedian and actor David Mitchell hosts an extended edition of the satirical current affairs quiz from October 2016, with Labour MP Chris Bryant and New Zealand comedian Rose Matafeo joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: Field Marshal Montgomery's daring airborne plan to end the war by Christmas, which went a bridge too far at Arnhem.

programme.title: Private Lives of the Monarchs
programme.desc: Tracy Borman explores the decadent Reformation court of Charles II, and uncovers some little-known facts about the king's famous mistress Nell Gwynn.

programme.title: Private Lives of the Monarchs
programme.desc: Tracy Borman examines the life of Henry VIII, revealing his physical deterioration in old age and the true story behind his famously short fourth marriage.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Medieval Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: King Edward II: A Mysterious Death
programme.desc: The controversy surrounding the death of Edward II, whose forced abdication preceded his mysterious demise while in custody.

programme.title: Medieval Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Arthur of Brittany: The Boy Who Should Have Been King
programme.desc: Prince Arthur of Brittany, who was subjected to the injustice of his bad uncle, John Plantagenet, the usurper of his throne and crown of England.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston journeys to Greece and Italy to uncover the truth about oracles - mythical figures who could reputedly hear and speak to gods.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The final episode examines the liberation of Auschwitz and other camps by the Soviet Red Army. However, freedom did not mean an end to the prisoners' suffering - many were mistreated by their liberators and thousands died for the want of medical treatment.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Chronicling the events that brought about the demise of the Third Reich, as the Allies arrived at the gates of Berlin and Hitler boarded himself up in his bunker, where it is believed he committed suicide. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A fully relocatable polar research station in Antarctica, which was inspired by a revolutionary icebreaking ship and ingenious designs for pre-fabricated buildings.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The creation of a set of Second World War sea defences built near the mouth of the River Thames to protect London. Plus, a concrete pyramid build during the Cold War.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.desc: An exploration of the Harz Mountain Railway in Germany - Europe's longest rail network - which still uses steam locomotives and has a murky, hidden past.

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Exploring the relationship that has developed over thousands of years between the people who live in monsoon regions and the wildlife they share them with. In the rice paddies of Assam, India, farmers battle a herd of hungry elephants over their crops, while on the Philippine island of Palawan, near Borneo, people still hunt in the forest and live in caves for part of the year. The programme also looks at the impact of organised religion, meeting members of the Bishnoi sect who believe that all life is sacred and have even been known to lay down their lives to protect trees. Colin Salmon narrates.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: Efforts to preserve the marine life of the region, which is home to the world's richest coral reefs and an array of species, including whales, sharks, albatross and tuna. Despite millions of people relying on its fish stocks, the seas have very little protection and face various threats, with international fishing fleets taking a disastrous toll. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Documentary exploring unusual rail networks from around the world, beginning with a look at trains in cities, including an inverted monorail in Wuppertal, Germany. With contributions from Susana Esteves da Fonseca.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The people responsible for tracking down war criminals who had evaded capture, beginning with the US army task force in charge of locating German scientists.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How Japan's early victories over Allied forces during the Second World War convinced its people that their strength and discipline would bring them victory. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of the Vajont Dam in the mountains of northern Italy, and the catastrophic flood in 1963 that caused the deaths of 2000 people.

programme.title: dinnerladies diaries
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of the British sitcom, featuring interviews with the cast as they reminisce about the show on its 20th anniversary.

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Philippa has a bright idea for raising the spirits of the kitchen staff. Comedy, starring Victoria Wood and Thelma Barlow.

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: The girls celebrate Japanese-style at their work party, and Bren enters right into the spirit of things - but not as much as her mother, who turns up unexpectedly. Comedy, starring Victoria Wood and Julie Walters.

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Morale plummets to its lowest point in the canteen with Tony in hospital and Dolly and Jean staging a walk-out, leaving Bren to run the graveyard shift single-handedly on the most important night of the year. Comedy, starring Victoria Wood, Andrew Dunn, Shobna Gulati and Celia Imrie.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville changes his image with the help of some trendy clothes and a medallion made from a cocoa tin lid, while Arkwright decides to increase his profits through advertising.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville places an ad in a lonely hearts magazine and finally meets the girl of his dreams. After stretching the truth about being a young executive with a flash sports car, his romance ends before it even begins. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright thinks he has pulled a fast one by offloading a job lot of genuine Yorkshire clothes horses onto rival shopkeeper Albert Gupta - until his competitor makes a profit on them. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: In a grim turn of events, the tooth of the abducted woman is found in the debris from a wood chipper, while Walker's ex-wife's boyfriend turns psychotic.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.sub-title: The Things We Do for Love
programme.desc: Regina threatens Sarah's future as George's life hangs in the balance, while Anna and Gino's honeymoon is clouded by the contents of Swanson's letter.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Major Cochrane is charged with the attempted rape of the daughter of an influential businessman. Elsewhere, rivalry surfaces between the men and women during a dragon boat race.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The Fusiliers decide to go to a local brothel in Hong Kong, but the visit has unforeseen consequences. Starring Robson Green and Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gina is reprimanded by Amanda Prosser for her drunken behaviour, but redeems herself by devising an impressive new initiative against antisocial behaviour. Ben Meadows pleads guilty to dealing drugs and agrees to provide information on all his contacts, while Amber is entrusted with the delicate task of telling a mother her son has been killed in an accident - but manages to get the wrong woman.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Lola treats an ailing baby whose mother has previously been accused of neglect, and intervenes when social services attempt to remove the infant, resolving to prove the woman is not responsible for her child's illness. Joseph and Jac disagree over a patient's surgery, and Bradley asks Donna to help him out by working a double shift, promising to take her out to a posh restaurant in return.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Part two of two. Tina and Sean eventually find each other in Australia, while back in Holby, Holly is involved in a road accident, a predicament which places extra pressure on the already fraught staff - will Charlie be able to cope with the increasing tension? Derek Thompson, Claire Goose and Sandra Huggett star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: The Boys Are Back in Town
programme.desc: Neil Manson and estranged wife Pippa consider getting back together, while Gabriel takes the opposite course in his private life and decides to stop seeing secret girlfriend Zoe Dowman. Sheelagh brings daughter Siobhan into the station to experience a day in the life of a police officer, while Jack Meadows and the CID team investigate the source of fake passports being printed somewhere in Sun Hill.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Kathy falls out with Phil over a mysterious woman that has entered his life. Gita loses her patience with Sanjay as she is stuck at home with the baby and Pat worries about Janine.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Franks car lot and The Queen Vic are hit by vandals in the dead of night. Clem expresses his unhappiness about Mark coming on the Amsterdam trip to both Shelly and Michelle.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Hoax calls are still causing problems for Blue Watch, but then a genuine emergency arises in the boiler room of a swimming pool. Meanwhile, Nick heads to Cyprus.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Donald has an encounter with former sweetheart Moira McIver, and plans to elope with her and make up for lost time. Ewan comes up with an innovative way to find a date for Jess, while the rivalry between Paul and Chester intensifies when they go head-to-head in a clay pigeon shooting competition.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: A new family arrives in Skelthwaite, putting Anna's nose out of joint. David is shocked when Karen is contacted by a figure from the past, and a fund-raising idea is put in motion.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: In an effort to find out what life is like for Darryl behind bars, Tracey decides to build her own prison in the attic - with Sharon as her cellmate. Comedy, with Linda Robson and Pauline Quirke.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie's competitive spirit is fired up when a broke Llewellyn challenges him to a pub quiz with a £5,000 jackpot - but sadly, Bryan, Jed and Marlene's general knowledge leaves a lot to be desired. Tyler tries to make amends after Beth accuses him of being anti-Welsh. Comedy, starring John Challis.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy hatches a plan to erect a flag in a prominent position - but first he needs to find one, and a pole to put it on. Brian Wilde stars.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy's dream concerning his flag finally comes to fruition, while Compo spots a romantic opportunity. Brian Wilde and Bill Owen star.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The detective duo investigate a series of murders, all of which seem connected to the Wetherton Arts Centre where a production of Oliver! is being rehearsed. However, the case takes an unexpected turn when the latest victim is a little closer to home. Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Sandra and the team unearth the 10-year-old case of a poet from Belfast whose burnt body was found in the scrapyard of a known gangster. Gerry becomes convinced the victim's links with the criminal fraternity led to his demise, but Brian has a different theory, believing the secret of his murder lies in his verse. Amanda Redman, Dennis Waterman and Alun Armstrong star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A terminally ill man's body is donated to medical research, but Sam uncovers evidence to suggest his death may not have been entirely natural. Amanda Burton stars as the sceptical forensic pathologist, with Mick Ford and William Armstrong.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five friends calling themselves the Leading Ladies answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Warwick Davis hosts.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Matthew, Jim, Debbie and Sharon pit their wits against a ruthless quiz genius in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Laurel cuts Dotty out of the burning tent, and as the toddler is taken to the doctor's surgery, Archie and Arthur find themselves in serious trouble, while Jai demands an explanation. Malone tells a furious Harriet that he has finished his dealings with Billy, Cain and Will, and Leyla encourages a dispirited Andrea to use the family holiday as a chance to remind Jamie why he married her.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Steve and Leanne view a nursery school for Oliver, but matters take a dramatic turn on their return home when Oliver suffers a seizure. Gail tells Sarah and David she expects them at her birthday soirée at Number 8, and Cathy threatens to quit her job.

programme.title: Coronavirus: Q&A
programme.desc: Nina Hossein puts viewers' questions on a range of subjects relating to the Covid-19 outbreak to a panel of expert guests.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team head for rural Cornwall, where they create a spectacular contemporary garden for Chris Finney, a former serviceman who was awarded the George Cross in 2003. A space age-inspired area - complete with solar dome - will test Chris's knowledge as a novice gardener, and provide a stimulating haven for his young family.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson hosts the big-prize quiz, in which another line-up of contestants answer questions that could change their lives. All they have to do is hold their nerve through 15 questions, with four lifelines on hand to help them - Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend, 50-50 and Ask the Host.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Rising Damp Forever
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary about the classic sitcom. Series creator Eric Chappell reveals the inspiration behind his comic creation and its journey to our screens and actor Don Warrington - who played Philip - returns to his adopted home town of Newcastle, where he revisits the Theatre Royal and reminisces about getting his big break alongside Leonard Rossiter and Frances de la Tour.

programme.title: Legend of Croc Gold
programme.desc: Gold miner Farley aims to save his family business in the deadly jungle - but a frustrated crew, suspicious tribal chiefs and unforgiving river threaten the mission. The boat crew discovers that a crucial miscalculation may have damaged the dredge beyond repair, while the Americans chase their first taste of Bougainville gold.

programme.title: What On Earth?
programme.desc: A strange structure spotted in Mongolia may be the lost tomb of Genghis Khan, and bizarre rings in Spain could lead to the lost city of Atlantis.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Building custom motorcycles with the gang at Orange County Choppers.

programme.title: World's Top 5
programme.desc: Five of the world's most impressive helicopters are pitted against one another in a variety of key categories.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe joins forces with a biologist and heads deep into a cave to help clean up a toxic sewer leak.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: An insight into the complex manufacturing processes that result in the production of plant oil extractors, power trainers and coffee pods.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: An insight into the complex manufacturing processes that produce beehives and cast-iron cookers.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How coloured crayons used by children and artists are created and how artisans and craftsmen make treasured mirrors in India.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Treasure hunter Drew Pritchard counts down some of his most memorable buys, from the incredibly rare and valuable to the exquisite and the quirky.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: A new captain takes command of the Cornelia Marie, hoping to change the boat's fortunes, and the Northwestern fishes without Edgar Hansen on board for the first time.

programme.title: Dive Wars Australia
programme.desc: Skin and Jay seek to fill their abalone quota, but their secret hunting spot is close to where a surfer was attacked by a great white shark just a week earlier.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: A scrap car gets revived for the race track, an artistic mastermind turns scrap metal into cool lighting,and an old office block is demolished close to a busy road.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer invests in a rare 1967 amphibious car, but it has some underlying problems that could eat away at his potential profit margin.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: A friend asks Wayne Carini to restore at vintage Dusenberg for the Newport Concours d'Elegance.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini tries to sell two classic Jaguars at the exclusive Bonhams auction in Greenwich, Connecticut.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do they turn trees into billions of pencils? How do they make liquorice? And, how do they use traditional techniques to weave the world's most fashionable lace?.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How one of the world's most valuable metals, platinum, is mined. Plus, the production of manga comics and a look at how lemons are turned into an Italian after-dinner drinks.

programme.title: Dive Wars Australia
programme.desc: Winter storms hit the coast, and the entire fleet must either brave the perilous conditions or stay in port and miss out on a valuable catch.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Ice and injuries cause the captains to consider desperate measures as the fleet battles for survival against an Arctic hurricane.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Eccentric military equipment collector Bruce Crompton and Hus head to freezing Finland following a hot tip. Up near the Arctic Circle there's a kind of Winter Wonderland of Second World War vehicles and equipment..

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a country estate mentioned in the Domesday Book, unearths a cupboard that has been unopened for decades and finds a weathervane dating to 1800

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.sub-title: To Break or Not to Break
programme.desc: A wooden boat is pulled from the Thames, but whether it will be restored or recycled remains to be seen. Plus, a look at how many crushed cars can be crammed into a container.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. As Edd China completes the BMW 635CSi renovation project, Mike Brewer values the vehicle and goes looking for a potential buyer.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. As Edd China completes the BMW 635CSi renovation project, Mike Brewer values the vehicle and goes looking for a potential buyer.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: After the birth of Daniel's child, the Rookies return to Coober Pedy. Kelly and Al battle the clock, the weather and a deadly cactus, in their hunt for the most valuable opal.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard searches for items worthy of restoration at the former Naval Royal Hospital School in Suffolk, where he learns a few lessons while trying to negotiate a deal.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Young Guns' claim is ravaged by a vast dust storm. Meanwhile, the Boulder Boys chase old leads and the Bushmen face a disaster fifteen metres underground.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.sub-title: We Have Not Yet Begun to Fight
programme.desc: Polar ice descends and each Skipper must choose flight or fight. The Saga is in danger of sinking and Jake needs to act quickly.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer spends more than £2,000 on a 1984 Corvette C4, leaving it up to Edd China to restore it to its former glory.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. As Edd China completes the restoration project, Mike Brewer has the 1984 Corvette C4 valued ready for selling.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The disturbing methods of female killers, who often take a less violent approach to murder than their male counterparts but can prove just as ruthless.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of 17-year old Casey Crowder who vanished afterher car ran out of fuel. With no leads, investigators were desperate for any CCTV clues.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of mother and daughter Angela and Ashley Hyke who went missing in July 2001, leaving candles burning and electric fans running in their home. Days later their bodies were found in shallow graves. Authorities quickly recognised that the key to identifying the murderer might lie in Angela's diary.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: NYPD officers and federal agents form a task force to dismantle New York's drug gangs.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Temperatures soar in Texas, and Sage Whitney is called to rescue a kitten trapped in a car engine.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown helps celebrity bull Bully, whose horn is growing into its head, and it is discovered that turtles are starving off the coast of Cairns.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A five-week-old puppy is struggling to walk, a cat and a snake are brought into the clinic after having a fierce fight and a water dragon causes mayhem.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Marjorie has enlisted her loved ones to help find a dress for her wedding in two months, while bride-to-be Lynette is at odds with her family and friends.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A customer does not like being the centre of attention, while a bride makes a return visit to the shop with her far from supportive mother.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A bride spends $11,000 on a dress, then decides it needs some alterations, while another customer who has recently lost a lot of weight is excited to try on gowns.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown and Lisa Chimes head out to the Blue Mountains after some of the most intense bushfires on record, to help pets and wildlife in the fire zone.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown treats a dog with a growth on its leg. However, after a thorough examination he finds a second lump in its mammary glands that could prove to be more sinister.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Charles Jantzen leads the biggest horse rescue of the year, while investigator Trischa Price comes to the aid of a dog left at home alone.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Charles Jantzen leads an investigation into a kennel suspected of housing more than 50 ill-treated dogs.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Rescue workers race to save a couple trapped in a car that crashed down an embankment, but they get a shock when they reach the victims.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: A case involving an artist who vanished on her way home from work. When her car was found abandoned in a car park, it set off a dark speculation about her disappearance.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 25-year-old BMX rider Brian Histand, who was last seen wandering a field in southern Phoenix in May 2013. Investigators considered whether his risky bike moves might have led him to a severe state of confusion.

programme.title: The Perfect Murder
programme.sub-title: The Curious Case of the Persian Violet
programme.desc: In 2004, 27-year-old Jarrod Davidson is shot dead outside his apartment. Next to him is a suspicious potted plant. Who killed him?.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The consultants find the pressure is on to make sales in the current economic climate. Audrey remodels a gown and Vera rescues a fitting when she alters a neckline.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride Mirjana needs to walk out of the store with a dress that same day, while wedding planner Bethany is looking for a dress to top all others.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Consultant Sarah struggles to find a dress for choosy bride Bernadette, while nurse Marcie is unable to make a decision.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Maria brings three generations of her family to her appointment, while Pamela is on the hunt for a grand ballroom-style dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Heather brings her three bridesmaids to the store, Meredith has no idea what style she is looking for and Isabel is accompanied by her fiance and fashion guru.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Magdalonie brings five very opinionated bridesmaids along with her for her dress appointment, while rugby player Michele, who has lymphoma, arrives with her fiance, mum and aunt.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three Brits spend a day at a market in Villeneuve-les-Avignon in the south of France. Back in the UK, they have to upcycle their purchases before selling everything on London's Portobello Road. Rob shows how to convincingly restore a battered frame, Natalie is convinced she'll make hundreds out of an apple cart, and Keira gives a little love to add value to a wooden trunk.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: A woman appears at Cashbrokers Pawnbrokers in Penzance with an autograph book signed by stars including the Rolling Stones and Cliff Richard. At Nikolas Patrick in Kent, pawnbroking brothers Charlie and Patrick try to raise cash for a set of vintage cameras and an exclusive designer pen with a sky-high price tag.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Janine's extreme obesity has her nearly immobile, meaning she must overcome both her physical and emotional pain if she's ever going to live a normal life again.

programme.title: Sister Wives
programme.desc: Tamron Hall sits down with Kody Brown and his wives to discuss the most explosive season yet. No topic is off limits as the family members open up about their experiences.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Terrified bride Kirsty longs for a confidence-boosting gown. Meanwhile, tomboy bride Laura never wears dresses, so Jo and Al try to convince her to embrace her feminine side.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at a wedding dress shop catering to larger customers.

programme.title: Dead of Winter
programme.desc: The case of 74-year-old widow Virginia Johannessen, who was shot dead in her home before another person was murdered on the same street. Police had to consider whether someone was targeting widows in the neighbourhood.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How killers who poison their victims rely on their targets' trust to commit their crimes, and why they sometimes murder more than once.
